alertRelabelConfigs.description: Adds option to add alert_relabel_configs to avoid duplicate alerts in alertmanager useful in H/A prometheus with different external labels but the same alerts @schema type: [object, null] @schema
alertRelabelConfigs.title: alertRelabelConfigs

enabled.description: If false, alertmanager will not be installed
enabled.title: enabled

annotations.description: Custom annotations for the PVC created by the alertmanager StatefulSet. Useful for configuring storage provider options such as disk type, KMS encryption keys, or custom volume name prefixes.
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description: If true, storage will create or use a persistent volume If false, storage will use emptyDir
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description: Custom labels for the PVC created by the alertmanager StatefulSet. Useful for selecting, grouping, and organizing so that they can be queried or targeted in deployments, policies, etc.
labels.title: labels

storageClass.description: If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass> If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is set, choosing the default provisioner.
storageClass.title: storageClass

commonMetaLabels.description: Additional labels to attach to all resources @schema type: [object, null] @schema
commonMetaLabels.title: commonMetaLabels

extraManifests.title: extraManifests

scrapeConfigFiles.title: scrapeConfigFiles

scrapeConfigs.description: scrapeConfigs (map) defines Prometheus' default scrape_configs. Each can be disabled by setting "enabled" to "false" or leaving it empty. The key sets the default "job_name". Further scrapeConfigs can be added as new keys, these are then enabled by default. Ref. https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#scrape_config @schema type: [object, null] @schema
scrapeConfigs.title: scrapeConfigs

automountServiceAccountToken.title: automountServiceAccountToken

This means you can bind in environment variables from secrets.  e.g. static environment variable:  - name: DEMO_GREETING    value: "Hello from the environment"  e.g. secret environment variable: - name: USERNAME   valueFrom:     secretKeyRef:       name: mysecret       key: username @schema type: [array, null] @schema

livenessProbeSuccessThreshold.title: livenessProbeSuccessThreshold

namespaces.title: namespaces

annotations.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume annotations @schema type: [object, null] @schema

enabled.description: If true, Prometheus server will create/use a Persistent Volume Claim If false, use emptyDir
enabled.title: enabled

existingClaim.title: existingClaim

labels.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume labels @schema type: [object, null] @schema
labels.title: labels

mountPath.title: mountPath

selector.description: Persistent Volume Claim Selector Useful if Persistent Volumes have been provisioned in advance Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#selector @schema type: [object, null] @schema
selector.title: selector

size.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume size
size.title: size

statefulSetNameOverride.description: If set it will override the name of the created persistent volume claim generated by the stateful set. @schema type: [string, null] @schema
statefulSetNameOverride.title: statefulSetNameOverride

storageClass.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume Storage Class If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass> If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is   set, choosing the default provisioner.  (gp2 on AWS, standard on   GKE, AWS & OpenStack) @schema type: [string, null] @schema
storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description: Subdirectory of Prometheus server data Persistent Volume to mount Useful if the volume's root directory is not empty @schema type: [string, null] @schema
subPath.title: subPath

volumeName.description: Persistent Volume Name Useful if Persistent Volumes have been provisioned in advance and you want to use a specific one @schema type: [string, null] @schema
volumeName.title: volumeName

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to Prometheus server pods @schema type: [object, null] @schema
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

podAntiAffinity.description: Pod anti-affinity can prevent the scheduler from placing Prometheus server replicas on the same node. The value "soft" means that the scheduler should *prefer* to not schedule two replica pods onto the same node but no guarantee is provided. The value "hard" means that the scheduler is *required* to not schedule two replica pods onto the same node. The default value "" will disable pod anti-affinity so that no anti-affinity rules will be configured (unless set in `server.affinity`). @schema type: [string, null] @schema
podAntiAffinity.title: podAntiAffinity

podAntiAffinityTopologyKey.description: If anti-affinity is enabled sets the topologyKey to use for anti-affinity. This can be changed to, for example, failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/zone
podAntiAffinityTopologyKey.title: podAntiAffinityTopologyKey

portName.title: portName

prefixURL.description: The URL prefix at which the container can be accessed. Useful in the case the '-web.external-url' includes a slug so that the various internal URLs are still able to access as they are in the default case. (Optional) @schema type: [string, null] @schema
prefixURL.title: prefixURL

readinessProbeSuccessThreshold.description: Set success threshold for readiness probe
readinessProbeSuccessThreshold.title: readinessProbeSuccessThreshold

releaseNamespace.description: releaseNamespace to enable only the release namespace for service discovery. By default all namespaces are included in service discovery. If releaseNamespace and namespaces are both set, a merged list will be created. Note that kubernetes_sd_configs.namespaces in scrape configs must be specified if namespaced service discovery is desired. Setting useExistingClusterRoleName is required.
releaseNamespace.title: releaseNamespace

resources.title: resources

retention.description: Prometheus data retention period (default if not specified is 15 days)

httpsRedirect.description: httpsRedirect adds a filter for redirecting to https (HTTP 301 Moved Permanently). To redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS, you need to have a Gateway with both HTTP and HTTPS listeners. Matches and filters do not take effect if enabled. Ref. https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/guides/http-redirect-rewrite/

parentRefs.title: parentRefs
